item.title: David Beazley: The Fun of Reinvention (Screencast)
item.description: In his keynote from PyCon Israel 2017 Python expert David Beazley talks about the fun of reinventing things and using and abusing new features in Python 3.6.

item.title: Pycon 2015: Beyond PEP 8 by Raymond Hettinger
item.description: This talk from PyCon 2015 by Raymond Hettinger is about how to leverage Python language features to writer better and more beautiful code.

item.title: Automatic Code Reviews by Carl Crowder
item.description: An interesting 20-min talk introducing some of the tools available to analyze and report on your Python code base.

item.title: Asset Management in Python by Robert Kluin and Beau Lyddon
item.description: This talk from PyCon 2013 by Robert Kluin and Beau Lyddon is about strategies for managing frontend assets like CSS and JavaScript files in Python.

item.title: Raymond Hettinger: Transforming code into Beautiful, Idiomatic Python
item.description: In this talk from PyCon 2013 Python core developer Raymond Hettinger provides a fast-paced overview of Python idioms that make your code faster and more beautiful.

item.title: Juan Velasco's Closing Keynote of OpenVis Conf 2013
item.description: Video of the closing keynote of OpenVis Conf 2013 by National Geographic magazine Art Director Juan Velasco.

item.title: 60 Epic Facts about Planet Earth
item.description: A video by the Earth Unplugged Crew with 60 epic facts that show why the earth is awesome.
